verses.latin: Verbum Domini, quod factum est ad Ioël filium Fathuël.
verses.english: The following is the word of the Lord, which came to Joel, the son of Fathuël.

verses.latin: Audite hoc, senes, et auribus percipite, omnes habitatores terræ: si factum est istud in diebus vestris, aut in diebus patrum vestrorum?
verses.english: Listen to this, you elders, and hear with your ears, all inhabitants of the earth: Has anything like this happened in your time, or in the time of your ancestors?

verses.latin: Narrate hoc filiis vestris, et filii vestri proximo suo, et proximus eorum alteri generationi.
verses.english: Tell your children this, and let your children tell their children, and their children tell the next generation.

verses.latin: Quod reliquit eruca, comedit locusta: et quod reliquit locusta, comedit bruchus: et quod reliquit bruchus, comedit rubigo.
verses.english: What the locusts left, the swarming locusts ate. What the swarming locusts left, the grasshoppers ate, and what the grasshoppers left, the mildew ate.

verses.latin: Expergiscimini ebrii, et flete; et ululate, omnes qui bibitis vinum in dulcedine, quoniam periit a vobis de ore vestro.
verses.english: Wake up, you drunkards, and weep! And wail, all you who drink wine in sweetness, because it is taken away from your mouth.

verses.latin: Quia gens ascendit super terram meam, fortis et innumerabilis: dentes ejus dentes leonis, et molae ejus molae leænae.
verses.english: For a nation has come up upon my land, strong and without number; its teeth are the teeth of a lion, and its molar teeth are those of a lioness.

verses.latin: Posuit vineam meam desolationem, et ficum meam in confractionem: nudans spoliansque eam, detraxit; spretæ sunt rami ejus.
verses.english: It has made my vineyard a desolation, and my fig tree a ruin. It has stripped it bare, and cast it away; its branches are despised.

verses.latin: Plange quasi virgo accincta sacco super virum pubertatis suæ.
verses.english: Lament like a virgin, girded with sackcloth, for the husband of her youth.

verses.latin: Consumptum est sacrificium et libatio de domo Domini: luxerunt sacerdotes, ministri Domini.
verses.english: The sacrifice and the libation are cut off from the house of the Lord; the priests, the ministers of the Lord, are in mourning.

verses.latin: Vastata est regio, luxit humus: quoniam vastatum est triticum, aruit vinum, defecit oleum.
verses.english: The fields are wasted, the ground is in mourning, because the wheat is ruined, the wine is dried up, the oil is gone.

verses.latin: Confusi sunt agricolæ; ululaverunt vinitores super frumento et hordeo, quoniam periit messis agri.
verses.english: The farmers are ashamed; the vinedressers wail over the wheat and the barley, for the harvest of the field has perished.

verses.latin: Aruit vinea, et ficus confracta est; malogranatum, et palma, et malum, et omnia ligna agri arierunt, quia confusus est gaudium a filiis hominum.
verses.english: The vine has dried up, and the fig tree is broken. The pomegranate, the palm, the apple, and all the trees of the field have withered; because joy has failed from the sons of men.

verses.latin: Zonamini et plangite, sacerdotes; ululate, ministri altaris: introite, dormite in sacco, ministri Dei mei, quoniam interclusum est de domo Dei vestri sacrificium et libatio.
verses.english: Gird yourselves and lament, priests; wail, ministers of the altar. Go in, lie in sackcloth, ministers of my God, because the sacrifice and the libation are cut off from the house of your God.

verses.latin: Sanctificate jejunium, vocate cœtum; congregate senes, omnes habitatores terræ in domum Dei vestri, et clamate ad Dominum.
verses.english: Sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly; gather the elders, all the inhabitants of the land, into the house of your God, and cry out to the Lord.

verses.latin: Heu diei, quia prope est dies Domini, et veniet quasi vastatio a potente.
verses.english: Alas for the day, because the day of the Lord is near, and it will come like a desolation from the Almighty.

verses.latin: Nonne coram oculis nostris cibus interciditur, de domo Dei nostri gaudium et exultatio?
verses.english: Isn’t the food cut off before our eyes, joy and exultation from the house of our God?

verses.latin: Aruerunt sementes sub glebis, jacuerunt horrea dissipata sunt: quoniam nullus est frumenti.
verses.english: The seeds have withered under the clods; the barns have been laid waste; because there is no grain.

verses.latin: Quomodo ingemuit jumentum! mugierunt armenta, quoniam non est pascua eis; sed et greges ovium dissipati sunt.
verses.english: How the animals groan! The herds of cattle are moaning, because they have no pasture; even the flocks of sheep are scattered.

verses.latin: Ad te, Domine, clamabo: quia ignis comedit speciosa solitudinis, et flamma succendit omnia ligna regionis.
verses.english: To you, Lord, I will cry out, because fire has devoured the beauty of the wilderness, and the flame has burned all the trees of the region.

verses.latin: Sed et bestiæ agri desiderant te, quia siccatus est torrens aquarum, et ignis comedit speciosa solitudinis.
verses.english: Even the beasts of the field long for you, because the torrent of waters is dried up, and fire has devoured the beauty of the wilderness.

verses.latin: Canite tuba in Sion: et clangite in monte sancto meo, contremescant omnes habitatores terrae. Quia venit dies Domini, quia prope est.
verses.english: Sound the trumpet in Zion! Give a warning cry on My holy mountain! Let all who live on earth tremble, because the day of the Lord is coming soon.

verses.latin: Dies tenebrarum et caliginis, dies nubis et turbinis: quasi aurora expansa super montes: populus multus et fortis; similis ei non fuit a principio, et post eum non erit usque in annos generationum.
verses.english: The day of darkness, of storm, of clouds, and of shadows is approaching! Like the dawn expanding on the mountains, there comes a great and mighty people the likes of which has never been, nor will there be again for generations to come.

verses.latin: Ante faciem ejus ignis vorans, et post eum exurens flamma: terra quasi paradisus ante eum, et post eum solitudo deserta; nec est qui effugiat eum.
verses.english: Ahead of them is a devouring fire, and behind them is a blazing flame. The land before them is as the Garden of Eden, and behind them, a desolate wasteland. Nothing escapes them.

verses.latin: Aspectus eorum quasi aspectus equorum: et quasi equites sic currebunt.
verses.english: They look like horses, and they run like warriors on horseback.

verses.latin: Sicut sonitus curruum super capita montium exilient: sicut sonitus flammae ignis devorantis stipulam: quasi populus fortis praeparatus ad proelium.
verses.english: Like the sound of chariots, they rush over the mountaintops. Like the crackling of a fire devouring the stubble, they are a mighty people prepared for battle.

verses.latin: A facie eorum contremescunt populi: omnes vultus in facie illorum, quasi in olla, nigrescunt.
verses.english: Nations tremble at their approach; their faces are black like those of a boiling pot.

verses.latin: Sicut viri fortes current, sicut viri bellatores ascendent murum: viri unusquisque in via sua gradietur, et non erunt turbati.
verses.english: They charge like warriors. Each goes straight ahead. They don’t get in each other’s way.

verses.latin: Unusquisque fratrem suum non impellit: viri gradiuntur in via sua: et inrumpunt per fenestras, quasi fur.
verses.english: They don't jostle one another; each marches straight ahead. They burst through windows like thieves.

verses.latin: In civitatem irruent: in muro current, et ascendent domos, per fenestras quasi fur.
verses.english: They storm the city; they run along the wall; they climb into the houses, entering like a thief through the windows.

verses.latin: A facie ejus contremuit terra, et contremuerunt caeli: sol et luna obscurati sunt, et stellae retraxerunt splendorem suum.
verses.english: The earth quakes before them, and the sky trembles. The sun and moon are darkened, and the stars no longer shine.

verses.latin: Et Dominus dedit vocem suam ante faciem exercitus sui: quoniam multa fortia ejus, et qui faciunt verbum ejus: quia magnus dies Domini, et terribilis nimis: et quis sustinebit eum?
verses.english: The Lord is giving his voice to His great army. The Lord's day is very great and exceedingly terrible. Who can endure it?

verses.latin: Nunc ergo dicit Dominus: Convertimini ad me in toto corde vestro, in jejunio, et in fletu, et in planctu.
verses.english: So now, says the Lord, “Turn back to Me with all your heart, and fast, and weep, and mourn.

verses.latin: Et scindite corda vestra, et non vestimenta vestra: et convertimini ad Dominum Deum vestrum, quia misericors et clemens est: patiens et multae misericordiae, et paenitet super malitia.
verses.english: Tear your hearts, not your clothes; return to the Lord your God, for He is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love; and He relents over disaster.

verses.latin: Quis scit si convertatur et paeniteat: et relinquet post se benedictionem, sacrificium et libamen Domino Deo vestro?
verses.english: Who knows whether He will relent and leave behind Him a blessing, a grain offering and a drink offering for the Lord your God?

verses.latin: Canite tuba in Sion, sanctificate jejunium, vocate coetum.
verses.english: Sound the trumpet in Zion! Declare a holy fast; call a sacred assembly.

verses.latin: Congregate populum, sanctificate ecclesiam, coadunate senes, congregate parvulos, et sugentes ubera: egrediatur sponsus de cubili suo, et sponsa de thalamo suo.
verses.english: Gather the people, consecrate the congregation; assemble the elders; gather the children, even nursing infants. Let the bridegroom leave his room, and the bride her chamber.

verses.latin: Inter vestibulum et altare plorabunt sacerdotes, ministri Domini, et dicent: Parce, Domine, parce populo tuo: et ne des hereditatem tuam in opprobrium, ut dominentur eis nationes. Quare dicerent in populis: Ubi est Deus eorum?
verses.english: Between the porch and the altar, let the priests, the ministers of the Lord, weep. Let them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord, and give not Your heritage to reproach, that the nations may rule over them. Why should they say among the peoples, ‘Where is their God?’”

verses.latin: Zelatus est Dominus terram suam, et pepercit populo suo.
verses.english: Then the Lord became jealous for His land and had pity on His people.

verses.latin: Et respondit Dominus, et dixit populo suo: Ecce ego mittam vobis triticum, et vinum, et oleum, et replebimini ex eis: et non dabo vos ultra opprobrium in gentibus.
verses.english: The Lord answered His people: “Behold, I will send you grain, wine, and oil, and you will be satisfied; and I will no longer make you a reproach among the nations.

verses.latin: Et procul faciam a vobis aquilonem, et expellam eum in terram inviam et desertam: et mittam in ea primam et novissimam pluviam, et pluet super terram.
verses.english: I will remove the northern army far from you, and drive it into a barren and desolate land, its front to the eastern sea and its rear to the western sea. And its stench will rise, and its foul odor will go up, for it has done great things.”

verses.latin: Non timeas, terra, exulta et laetare: quoniam magnificavit Dominus ut faceret.
verses.english: Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice, for the Lord has done great things!

verses.latin: Nolite timere, animalia regionis, quia germinaverunt speciosa deserto: quoniam lignum portavit fructum suum, ficus et vinea dederunt virtutem suam.
verses.english: Fear not, you beasts of the field, for the pastures of the wilderness are green; the tree bears its fruit; the fig tree and vine give their strength.

verses.latin: Et filii Sion exultate, et laetamini in Domino Deo vestro: quia dedit vobis doctrinam iustitiae, et descendere faciet vobis imbrem matutinum et serotinum, sicut in principio.
verses.english: And children of Zion, be glad and rejoice in the Lord your God! For He has given you the early rain for your vindication; and He will pour down for you the rain, both the early and the late.

verses.latin: Et implebuntur areae frumento, et redundabunt torcularia vino et oleo.
verses.english: The threshing floors shall be full of grain; the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.

verses.latin: Et restituam vobis annos, quos comedit locusta, bruchus, et erugo, et calvus: exercitus meus magnus, quem misi in vobis.
verses.english: “I will restore the years that the locust has eaten—the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter, My great army, which I sent among you.

verses.latin: Et comedetis, et saturabimini, et laudabitis nomen Domini Dei vestri, qui fecit mirabilia vobiscum: et non confundetur populus meus in sempiternum.
verses.english: You shall eat in plenty and be satisfied, and praise the name of the Lord your God, who has dealt wondrously with you. And My people shall never again be put to shame.

verses.latin: Et scietis quia ego in medio Israel sum: et ego Dominus Deus vester, et non est alius: et non confundetur populus meus in sempiternum.
verses.english: You shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, and that I am the Lord your God and there is no other. And My people shall never again be put to shame.

verses.latin: Et erit post haec, effundam spiritum meum super omnem carnem: et prophetabunt filii vestri et filiae vestrae: senes vestri somnia somniabunt, et iuvenes vestri visiones videbunt.
verses.english: “And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh; your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, and your young men shall see visions.

verses.latin: Sed et super servos et ancillas in diebus illis effundam spiritum meum.
verses.english: Even on the male and female servants in those days I will pour out My Spirit.

verses.latin: Et dabo prodigia in caelo et in terra, sanguinem, et ignem, et columnas fumi.
verses.english: “And I will show wonders in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and columns of smoke.

verses.latin: Sol convertetur in tenebras, et luna in sanguinem: antequam veniat dies Domini magnus et horribilis.
verses.english: The sun shall be turned to darkness, and the moon to blood, before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes.

verses.latin: Et erit omnis qui invocaverit nomen Domini salvus erit: quia in monte Sion, et in Jerusalem erit salvatio, sicut dixit Dominus, et in residuis quos vocaverit Dominus.
verses.english: And it shall come to pass that everyone who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved. For in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be those who escape, as the Lord has said, and among the survivors shall be those whom the Lord calls.

verses.latin: Quia ecce in diebus illis, et in tempore illo, cum convertero captivitatem Juda et Jerusalem,
verses.english: For, in those days, and at that time, I will restore the prosperity of Judah and Jerusalem,

verses.latin: congregabo omnes gentes, et deducam eas in valle Josaphat: et disceptabo cum eis ibi super populo meo, et haereditate mea Israël, quos disperserunt in nationibus, et terram meam diviserunt.
verses.english: I will gather all nations and bring them down to the valley of Josaphat. There I will judge them for what they did to My people and My inheritance, Israel, whom they scattered among the nations, and for dividing My land.

verses.latin: Et super populum meum miserunt sortem: et dederunt puerum pro prostituta, et puellam pro vino, ut biberent.
verses.english: They cast lots for My people, and gave a boy for a prostitute, and a girl for wine, so that they might drink.

verses.latin: Et quid vobis, Tyro, et Sidone, et omnibus finibus Palestinorum? Numquid opera mea haec vultis? vel quid vos mihi facitis?
verses.english: And what are you doing, Tyre, and Sidon, and all the territories of the Philistines? Are you trying to take My works from Me? Or what are you doing to Me?

verses.latin: Quia si opera mea haec facitis, velociter cito reddam retributionem vestram in caput vestrum.
verses.english: If you do these things, I will quickly and swiftly bring your actions down upon your own heads.

verses.latin: Argentum enim meum et aurum tulistis: et desiderabilia mea et pulchra intulistis in templa vestra.
verses.english: You have taken My silver and gold, and have brought My precious and beautiful things into your temples.

verses.latin: Et filios Juda, et filios Jerusalem vendidistis filiis Græcorum, ut longe faceretis eos a finibus suis.
verses.english: You have sold the sons of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, so that you might remove them far from their territory.

verses.latin: Ecce ego suscitabo eos de loco in quo vendidistis eos: et reddam retributionem vestram in caput vestrum.
verses.english: Behold, I will stir them up from the place where you have sold them, and I will return your retribution on your own heads.

verses.latin: Et vendam filios vestros et filias vestras in manu filiorum Juda, et vendent eos Sabeis genti longinquæ: quia Dominus locutus est.
verses.english: I will sell your sons and daughters into the hands of the sons of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, a distant nation, because the Lord has spoken.

verses.latin: Clamate hoc in gentibus: Sanctificate bellum: suscitate fortissimos: accedant, ascendant omnes viri bellatores.
verses.english: Proclaim this among the nations: Prepare for war! Rouse the warriors! Let all the soldiers advance and come forward!

verses.latin: Conflate gladios vestros in pilos, et lanceas vestras in falces: dicat infirmus, Quia fortis ego sum.
verses.english: Beat your plowshares into swords and your spears into sickles. Let the weak say, “I am strong.”

verses.latin: Festinate, et venite omnes gentes, et congregamini ex circuitu: illuc congregare Dominus fortes tuos.
verses.english: Hurry and come, all you nations from every side, and gather there; there the Lord will gather His mighty ones.

verses.latin: Descendant gentes in vallem Josaphat: quia ibi sedebo, ut judicem omnes gentes in circuitu.
verses.english: Let the nations go down to the valley of Josaphat, because there I will sit to judge all the nations from every side.

verses.latin: Mittite falcem: quoniam maturuit messis: ite, et descendite, quia plena est torcularia, repleti sunt torcularia: confluant torcularia: quia multiplicata est malitia eorum.
verses.english: Put in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come, tread the winepress, for it is full; the vats overflow, for their wickedness is great.

verses.latin: Turba turbarum in valle Judicium: quia prope est dies Domini in valle Judicium.
verses.english: Multitudes, multitudes, in the valley of judgment! For the day of the Lord is near in the valley of judgment.

verses.latin: Sol et luna obtenebrati sunt, et stellæ retraxerunt splendorem suum.
verses.english: The sun and moon are darkened, and the stars withdraw their brilliance.

verses.latin: Et de Sion rugiet Dominus, et de Jerusalem dabit vocem suam: et movebuntur cæli et terra, et Dominus spera populi sui, et fortitudo filiorum Israël.
verses.english: The Lord will roar from Zion, and give His voice from Jerusalem; and the heavens and the earth will shake, and the Lord will be the hope of His people and the strength of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et scietis quoniam ego Dominus Deus vester habitans in Sion, sancto monte meo: et erit Jerusalem sancta, et alieni non transibunt per eam amplius.
verses.english: And you will know that I am the Lord your God, dwelling in Zion, My holy mountain. Jerusalem will be holy, and strangers will no longer pass through it.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa: stillabunt montes dulcedinem, et colles fluent lac et mel: et per omnes rivos Judæ fluent aquæ: et fons de domo Domini exibit, et irrigabit torrentem spinarum.
verses.english: And in that day, the mountains will drip with sweetness, and the hills will flow with milk and honey, and all the streams of Judah will flow with water. A fountain will come out from the house of the Lord, and will water the torrent of thorns.

verses.latin: Ægyptus in desolationem erit, et Idumæa in desertum perditionis: eo quod iniquum egerint in filios Juda, et effuderint sanguinem innocentem in terra eorum.
verses.english: Egypt will become a desolation, and Edom a desert wasteland, because they did evil to the sons of Judah and shed innocent blood in their land.

verses.latin: Et mundabo sanguinem eorum, quem non mundaveram: et Dominus habitabit in Sion.
verses.english: But I will avenge their blood, and will not hold them guiltless, and the Lord will dwell in Zion.
